channel.title: Menus on my RuneScape client
channel.description:
Hello,
I made a runescape client and I tried adding menus. It does appear but the problem is is the list under the menu seems as if it's under the Runescape applet. Does anyone know what I can do to fix this? I will attach a picture of the problem below so you can look and understand what I am saying better.
Thanks, poke1103

item.title: Menus on my RuneScape client
item.dc:creator: @lawl lawl
item.description:
@lawl wrote:

[quote=“abraham2119, post:6, topic:322901”][quote author=poke1103 link=topic=419308.msg3080870#msg3080870 date=1262137564]
Alright, thanks a lot guys! I’ll try to google it. :)[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 29, 2009, 07:54:45 pm[/size][hr]Ooh. Guys I tried looking it up on google and is all I found was a bunch of stuff that doesn’t have anything to do with this lol. Does anyone know what I could do? Or if there’s a website that explains it better?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 29, 2009, 08:54:10 pm[/size][hr]Can anyone help?
[/quote]

[quote author=spank link=topic=419308.msg3080867#msg3080867 date=1262137348]As a workaround, invoke JPopupMenu.setLightWeightPopupEnabled(false).
[/quote][/quote]
make sure you do that before any gui (swing) calls

Read full topic

item.title: Menus on my RuneScape client
item.dc:creator: @abraham2119 abraham2119
item.description:

poke1103:

Alright, thanks a lot guys! I’ll try to google it. :)[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 29, 2009, 07:54:45 pm[/size][hr]Ooh. Guys I tried looking it up on google and is all I found was a bunch of stuff that doesn’t have anything to do with this lol. Does anyone know what I could do? Or if there’s a website that explains it better?[br][br][size=1]Posted on: December 29, 2009, 08:54:10 pm[/size][hr]Can anyone help?

spank:

As a workaround, invoke JPopupMenu.setLightWeightPopupEnabled(false).

Read full topic

item.title: Menus on my RuneScape client
item.dc:creator: @spankjava spank
item.description:
@spankjava wrote:

static void setLightWeightPopupEnabled(boolean)

By default, Swing implements a menu’s window using a lightweight component. This can cause problems if you use any heavyweight components in your Swing program, as described in Bringing Up a Popup Menu. (This is one of several reasons to avoid using heavyweight components.) As a workaround, invoke JPopupMenu.setLightWeightPopupEnabled(false).

Read full topic

item.title: Menus on my RuneScape client
item.dc:creator: @Zero_Freeze ZeroFreeze
item.description:
@Zero_Freeze wrote:

the menu is light-weight and it’s trying to draw on top of a heavy-weight component.

Read full topic

item.description:
@spankjava wrote:

Its to do with heavyweight/lightweight componants
